goal: Update Client API to support bulk operations
acceptance_criteria: POST /api/clients/bulk-create accepts array of client objects
POST /api/clients/bulk-update accepts array of client updates
Bulk operations are transactional (all or nothing)
OpenAPI schema updated with new endpoints
Backward compatibility maintained for single-client endpoints
ADR created for API contract change
approach: Add bulk endpoints to ClientViewSet. Use Django transactions for atomicity. Create serializers for bulk operations. Update OpenAPI schema. Write comprehensive tests including edge cases.
verification_plan: Verify OpenAPI schema: make -C backend openapi
Test backward compatibility: Verify single-client endpoints still work
Manual test: Use Postman/curl to test bulk endpoints
risks: Breaking change: API contract change requires ADR (Principle 23)
Performance: Bulk operations may be slow for large datasets
Transaction size: Large bulk operations may hit database limits
rollback_plan: Revert commits. Remove bulk endpoints. Restore previous API version. Update OpenAPI schema. Remove ADR if not merged.
notes: This is an API change (change_type: api_change). Requires ADR per Principle 23 (cross-boundary API contract change). Related to TASK-078.
